TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Effect extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Effects are high-performance transformations that can be applied to image frames.

remarks.para: Effects are high-performance transformations that can be applied to image frames. These are passed in the form of OpenGL ES 2.0 texture names. Typical frames could be images loaded from disk, or frames from the camera or other video streams.
To create an Effect you must first create an EffectContext. You can obtain an instance of the context's EffectFactory by calling . The EffectFactory allows you to instantiate specific Effects.

The application is responsible for creating an EGL context, and making it current before applying an effect. An effect is bound to a single EffectContext, which in turn is bound to a single EGL context. If your EGL context is destroyed, the EffectContext becomes invalid and any effects bound to this context can no longer be used.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Apply (int inputTexId, int width, int height, int outputTexId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Apply(int32 inputTexId, int32 width, int32 height, int32 outputTexId) cil managed

Docs.param: The GL texture name of a valid and bound input texture.
The width of the input texture in pixels.
The height of the input texture in pixels.
The GL texture name of the output texture.
Docs.summary: Apply an effect to GL textures.

remarks.para: Apply an effect to GL textures.
Apply the Effect on the specified input GL texture, and write the result into the output GL texture. The texture names passed must be valid in the current GL context.

The input texture must be a valid texture name with the given width and height and must be bound to a GL_TEXTURE_2D texture image (usually done by calling the glTexImage2D() function). Multiple mipmap levels may be provided.

If the output texture has not been bound to a texture image, it will be automatically bound by the effect as a GL_TEXTURE_2D. It will contain one mipmap level (0), which will have the same size as the input. No other mipmap levels are defined. If the output texture was bound already, and its size does not match the input texture size, the result may be clipped or only partially fill the texture.

Note, that regardless of whether a texture image was originally provided or not, both the input and output textures are owned by the caller. That is, the caller is responsible for calling glDeleteTextures() to deallocate the input and output textures.

Get the effect name.
Returns the unique name of the effect, which matches the name used for instantiating this effect by the EffectFactory.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Release() cil managed

remarks.para: Releases the effect and any resources associated with it. You may call this if you need to make sure acquired resources are no longer held by the effect. Releasing an effect makes it invalid for reuse.
Note that this method must be called with the EffectContext and EGL context current, as the effect may release internal GL resources.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetUpdateListener(class Android.Media.Effect.IEffectUpdateListener listener) cil managed

Docs.param: The listener to receive update callbacks on.

remarks.para:
Set an effect listener.
Some effects may report state changes back to the host, if a listener is set. Consult the individual effect documentation for more details.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
